name: Mount Liberty

trails_config.name: Liberty Spring Trail
trails_config.description: A popular Appalachian Trail approach: steadily climb Liberty Spring Trail, passing a tentsite, then join the Franconia Ridge Trail for a short, steep final ascent to Liberty’s rocky top. This hike is beloved for its autumn foliage and the dramatic view of Franconia Notch and the neighboring peaks from the pointed summit.

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Liberty rises to 4459 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4459 feet, Mount Liberty is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Liberty Spring Trail**, a **8.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Flume**, which is just 1.3 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
